Motilal Oswal Securities suggests buying Phoenix Mills, projecting growth driven by new mall commissioning. HSBC maintains a buy rating on Bharti Airtel, citing rising ARPU and expanding broadband subscribers. CLSA has an outperform rating on Bajaj Finance, highlighting AI initiatives and NIM expansion.

description: Ravichandran Ashwin defended Digvesh Rathi's display of personality, while praising Rana's handling of media questions after their on-field clash. Rana, who was provoked, responded with aggressive play, leading West Delhi Lions to victory. Both players were penalized for breaching the code of conduct, but Rana's team ultimately won the league championship.

description: Ibrahim Zadran and Sediqullah Atal's consecutive half-centuries propelled Afghanistan to an 18-run victory over Pakistan in the T20 tri-series. Afghanistan's spin trio restricted Pakistan to 151 for 9, successfully defending their total of 169 for 5. Despite Mohammad Haris's late flourish, Afghanistan's early dominance with both bat and ball secured the win.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Are Suryakumar Yadav’s India undercooked? Big continental test awaits
description: Defending champions India enter the Asia Cup 2025 as favorites, despite a recent lack of T20I match practice. Irfan Pathan believes India's strong NCA system ensures adequate preparation, cautioning them mainly against Afghanistan's potent spinners. He also highlighted Shubman Gill's vice-captaincy as beneficial and revealed Rohit Sharma's desire to continue playing ODIs, contingent on maintaining fitness and game-time.

title: 'Coolie' Box Office collection day 20: Rajinikanth’s action film mints Rs 1.10 crore
description: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' continues its box office run into its third week. The film experienced a weekend surge in collections. However, weekday earnings saw a decline. 'Coolie' has earned Rs 281.30 crore in India so far. 'War 2', another release, lags behind 'Coolie' in earnings. The film 'Coolie' stars Rajinikanth as Deva, a former union leader.

title: Judge orders search shakeup in Google monopoly case but keeps hands off Chrome and default deals
description: The judge refrained from ordering a sale of Chrome because he decided there wasn’t adequate proof the browser served as an essential ingredient in Google’s search monopoly, making a divestiture “a poor fit for this case”

India-Germany talks: Wadephul in Delhi; Ukraine conflict, trade ties on table
description: German Foreign Minister Johann David Wadephul is in India to discuss the Ukraine conflict and strengthen trade ties. Talks with S Jaishankar will likely address potential secondary sanctions against Russia, which could impact India's energy relations. Jaishankar is expected to reiterate India's support for dialogue and a peaceful resolution, a message previously conveyed to Vladimir Putin.

title: Maratha quota row: Not all of Jarange’s demands accepted by govt; what latest assurance means
description: Manoj Jarange ended his hunger strike after the Maharashtra government conceded to several demands aimed at simplifying the process for Marathas with Kunbi antecedents to obtain OBC certificates. While blanket reservation was deemed legally untenable, the government agreed to implement the Hyderabad gazette and establish village-level committees to facilitate certificate issuance.

description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced upcoming GST reforms aimed at creating a more open and transparent economy, reducing compliance burdens for small businesses. The proposed changes include simplifying the tax slab structure, streamlining registration and filing processes, and addressing rate concerns across various industries.

title: Trump announces that Space Command is moving from Colorado to Alabama
description: Alabama and Colorado have long battled to claim Space Command, with elected officials from both states asserting their state is the better location

'Param Sundari' Box Office: Sidharth-Janhvi film picks up on Tuesday; earns over Rs 34 crore
description: Param Sundari witnessed a box office resurgence. The film's domestic collection surpassed Rs 34 crore. The movie had a strong opening weekend, followed by a Monday dip. Tuesday estimates suggest a rise. Overseas, the film earned nearly $1.5 million. The film stars Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor. The movie revolves around a digital romance set in Kerala.

title: ‘Power couple’: Swift enters engagement with $1.6bn fortune; Kelce adds $70m
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are engaged, marking a significant milestone for the couple. Swift's impressive $1.6 billion net worth, fueled by her music empire and strategic investments, combines with Kelce's $70 million fortune earned through his NFL career and diverse ventures. Together, they form a power couple with a combined net worth of $1.67 billion.

title: Deputy CM hands over appointment orders under sports quota
How dead birds, old maps are helping scientists track biodiversity loss
description: A new study’s methods highlight the sort of innovation researchers can resort to in order to elicit new ecological and conservation wisdom. While field-based studies remain invaluable to understand the natural history of a habitat or species, data collected decades ago provides historical context to current biodiversity baselines

title: Tamil Nadu Raptor Research Foundation conducts meeting to discuss conservation threats
description: Tamil Nadu, home to key raptor habitats such as the Western Ghats, Eastern Ghats, and coastal wetlands, is also seeing increasing pressures on these species due to habitat loss, poisoning, electrocution, and illegal trade

title: When a historic election in 1977 turned Tamil Nadu political landscape bipolar
description: The year has always been a source of attraction to many in Tamil Nadu, be they from politics or the cinema. Actor Vijay’s Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK), which is planning to enter the electoral fray in 2026, has been fancying 1977, apart from 1967.

title: ‘We’re going in’, says Trump on federal intervention in Chicago and Baltimore despite local opposition
description: President Donald Trump says he will direct federal law enforcement intervention to combat crime in Chicago and Baltimore, despite staunch opposition from state and local officials in both cities

Epstein Files: US House panel releases first batch; 33,000 investigation documents made public
description: The US House of Representatives committee has released the initial set of documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. Over 33,000 pages were uploaded to the committee website. The Justice Department provided these records. Committee aims for full transparency. More records are expected, with redactions to protect victims. This follows criticism of the Trump administration regarding document release.

description: If the regulatory assets reported by DISCOMs operating in Delhi are to be recovered within the four-year window set by the apex court, they need to recover about Rs 16,580 crore a year

description: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin is scheduled to deliver address at the University of Oxford in the United Kingdom to mark the centenary of the Self-Respect Movement on September 4, 2025

title: Injured Olympic 200m champion Gabby Thomas out of World Championships
description: Thomas’s absence will sting for the Americans, who led the Paris athletics medal table by a considerable margin, but the 28-year-old said she had received plenty of well wishes after announcing she would not compete

NHAI to fly in heavy equipment to fix Kullu-Manali highway
description: Following heavy rain and floods, the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) is set to airlift nine pieces of heavy construction equipment to restore the damaged Kullu-Manali highway. Restoration work is underway at 12 completely damaged and five partially damaged locations on NH-21. The NHAI has requested assistance from the Himachal Pradesh government to expedite the process.

title: ‘Green signal’: Govt lifts curbs on ethanol from cane; sugar rallies, tenders expected
description: The government has lifted restrictions on ethanol production from various sugarcane sources for the 2025-26 ethanol supply year, prompting a surge in sugar stocks. This decision, aimed at boosting ethanol supply, comes as oil marketing companies prepare to issue tenders. The government will monitor sugar diversion to ensure adequate domestic sweetener availability.

title: Manchester City sign Italy goalkeeper Donnarumma from PSG
description: Financial details were not disclosed but British media reported that City paid £30 million for Donnarumma, who will wear the number 99 shirt, and agreed to sell Ederson for £12 million

title: ‘Anxious nights’: Yamuna 1m over danger mark, 10,000 displaced; Ghaziabad, Noida on alert
description: Heavy rainfall and consistent discharge from Haryana's Hathinikund barrage caused the Yamuna River to swell dangerously in Noida and Ghaziabad, prompting the evacuation of over 600 people and 1,400 animals. Authorities are reinforcing embankments and activating relief centers, learning from the devastating 2023 floods.

title: 'Entitled ones': PM Modi's jab at Tejashwi, Rahul; 'kaamdaar vs naamdaar' returns before Bihar polls
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi strongly criticized the RJD and Congress, accusing them of disrespecting his late mother and insulting womanhood during a recent political event in Bihar. Addressing a large gathering of women, he urged them to hold the opposition accountable for their actions and sought their blessings for the upcoming elections.

title: Fujairah Global Superstars: Pranav Venkatesh wins with a record performance
Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran is guest at Adda today
Cheque bounce convict can make deal, avoid jail: SC
description: The Supreme Court has ruled that individuals convicted in cheque bounce cases can avoid jail time by reaching a compromise with the complainant. The court emphasized that cheque dishonor is primarily a civil wrong, making convictions unsustainable once a compromise deed is signed.

title: McMillan appointed White Ferns’ batting, fielding coach ahead of World Cup
description: McMillan had earlier been part of the New Zealand women team during their T20 World Cup triumph in 2024

title: Celebrating Vinayaka
46 industrial plots allotted in e-auction: UPSIDA
Bengal assembly erupts: TMC, BJP spar over Army stage row; Suvendu Adhikari suspended
description: The Bengal assembly witnessed uproar following the Army's action. The Army tried to remove a Trinamool protest stage. This led to Suvendu Adhikari's suspension during a special session. The session addressed attacks on Bengali migrant workers. Minister Bratya Basu compared the Army's action to the Pakistani Army's 1971 actions. BJP legislators protested Basu's remarks.

title: UP govt approves policy on manufacturing of key electronic components
South Africa's Maharaj, Markram punish England in seven-wicket win
description: South Africa sent England into bat and the home side made a bright start as they reached 82-2 in the 14th over, before losing their last eight wickets for just 49 runs following an innings peppered with poor shot selections

title: Rajasthan govt drops Centre’s age cap for enrolment in coaching centres
description: The Rajasthan government, led by Bhajan Lal Sharma, is set to introduce a revised coaching center bill that defies Union education ministry guidelines by not imposing a minimum age for enrollment. This decision, criticized by the opposition, comes after a drop in coaching industry enrollments and relaxes penalties for violations.

title: Protest over SRMU degree in Barabaki: CM orders probe, CO removed after police lathicharge students

description: A late fightback from the Bulls wasn’t enough, as Ashu Malik (15 points), Neeraj Narwal (7), and strong defensive efforts from Surjeet Singh, Fazel Atrachali and Saurabh Nandal sealed the win for Delhi

description: Gill made a comeback to the shortest format for the continental tournament following a successful debut series as Test captain, and Pathan said it isn’t something that would put pressure on incumbent leader Suryakumar Yadav

title: 'I was left penniless, my stuff moved out of home': Indrani Mukerjea's daughter
description: Vidhie Mukerjea, a key witness, alleges forged statements and accuses Rahul and Rabin Mukerjea of siphoning Indrani's assets after her arrest. She claims they took jewellery and savings, leaving Indrani unable to defend herself, and that Rabin threatened her.

title: Handful of Sikhs living in Afghanistan donate relief material for earthquake victims in Kunar
Supreme Court Collegium proposes appointment of 26 new judges to Allahabad High Court
description: The Collegium, in two separate proposals, has recommended 14 judicial officers and 12 advocates, the latter batch of which include two senior women lawyers from the Supreme Court Bar

title: ‘Why not step into governor’s shoes?’: SC on bills row; TN seeks timelines
description: In response to Tamil Nadu’s defence of deemed assent for delayed bills, the Supreme Court questioned, “If SC can grant deemed assent... why can't we step into the governor’s shoes?” Singhvi argued governors distort governance by indefinitely delaying bills. The bench cautioned against overreach, stressing constitutional procedure. “We will deal with the Presidential Reference constitutionally,” it said.

title: Daily Horoscope Today 3 September, 2025: Gemini, Sagittarius and other sun signs – check astrological predictions

J&K Opposition parties express dismay over constructing Police Martyrs’ building on 70-year-old playground in Srinagar
description: PDP leader and Pulwama MLA Waheed-ur-Rehman Parra said the land for the Police Martyrs’ building has been a playground for 70 years; JKAP president Syed Altaf Bukhari termed the police’s move as “deeply concerning”

title: U.P. government orders probe into lathi charge on ABVP activists in Barabanki, CO removed
description: The incident happened on Monday (September 1, 2025) when ABVP workers and students staged a protest at the Shri Ram Swaroop Memorial University in Barabanki, alleging that the university is accepting admissions in LLB course even after its recognition was cancelled

title: Sickle cell: The battle for disability justice
description: The continual reliance on biomedical scoring and exclusion of people with sickle cell disease from full protections undermines the very purpose of recognising the condition under the Act

description: The sluggish trial is not an aberration; it is part of an unfortunate trend

description: The suspension of operations agreement has been in limbo since February 29, 2024

title: Trump says he’s committed to sending National Guard troops to Chicago
A hundred years ago | Miners’ strike in U.S.A.
Kishtwar floods: What led to the tragedy that claimed 65 lives? Officials share findings
description: A preliminary investigation revealed that dual cloudbursts, not a glacial lake outburst flood, triggered the devastating flash floods in Kishtwar's Chasoti village on August 14, resulting in 65 fatalities. A prior government study had already warned of GLOF risks in vulnerable tehsils like Padder, Machail, Dachhan, Marwah, and Warwan, highlighting their susceptibility to sudden flooding events.

title: Fifty years ago | India’s concern over IMF’s new move on gold
IUML protest against corruption disrupts activities at Kozhikode Corporation office
description: Protest against alleged corruption and mismanagement in the Corporation

title: Six Pakistani security personnel, six militants killed during attack on paramilitary base
description: The attack began after a suicide bomber rammed the compound of the paramilitary base in Bannu; the ensuing gun battle lasted for 12 hours, police said

title: Behind Maratha quota issue resolution, a climbdown by both the Mahayuti government and the activist
description: Over the last few days, the Cabinet subcommittee on Maratha reservation held four meetings. Drafts for the orders were kept ready, but the government maintained that it was firm on finding a constitutional solution to the deadlock

title: ‘Embarrassing’: Fans slam Belichick’s moment with Hudson; UNC loss adds fuel to outrage
description: Bill Belichick and Jordon Hudson face backlash after the North Carolina Tar Heels' defeat against TCU, Belichick's first game as coach. A video showing Hudson on the field before the game sparked outrage among fans, who criticized her presence and perceived influence on Belichick. Despite the controversy and fan criticism, Belichick and Hudson have not yet responded to the situation.

title: Hyderabad launches cyber innovation hub to strengthen digital security
description: The initiative, housed within IIIT Hyderabad campus, spans more than 3,000 square feet and is equipped with specialised tools and infrastructure dedicated to cybersecurity

title: Bomb blast kills at least 11 at rally in southwestern Pakistan, officials say
description: Police said they were investigating the blast, which appeared to be a suicide bombing; no group has claimed responsibility so far

title: ‘One-sided relationship’: Trump repeats tariff charge on India; cites Harley Davidson
description: US President Trump criticised India’s “tremendous tariffs” on US goods, citing Harley Davidson’s 200% duty. He claimed Indian products faced no such barriers in the US. Highlighting unfair trade, he said Harley built a plant in India to avoid tariffs. Trump plans an “expedited ruling” from the Supreme Court after a lower court deemed many of his tariffs illegal.

title: MP HC judge recuses from mining case after BJP MLA's bid to contact him
description: Justice Vishal Mishra withdrew from an illegal mining case. This happened after Sanjay Pathak, a BJP MLA, contacted him. Pathak's son and mother are directors of Nirmala Minerals. The company faces accusations of illegal mining in Jabalpur and Katni. A petition was filed after inaction on a complaint. The case is now before the Chief Justice.

title: Consumer Commission comes down heavily on LIC
description: The bench strongly criticised LIC for attempting to repudiate claims while being willing to issue policies to vulnerable clients

title: U.P. Cabinet approves formation of Outsource Service Corporation
description: Move aimed at ensuring transparency and employee rights, says the state government

title: Chandigarh records 40.8 mm rainfall, schools to remain closed today
Student anger spills over as SFI stages protests over pending fee reimbursement
description: According to SFI State committee, the State government owes ₹8,158 crore dues towards RTF in the past six years

title: Solar storm hits Earth with 21 lakh kmph winds; power grids and satellites on high alert
description: A powerful solar storm, triggered by a rare cannibal CME on August 30, 2025, struck Earth, impacting power grids and satellites. The event, exceeding initial forecasts, caused geomagnetic disturbances and stunning auroras visible at unusually low latitudes. As Solar Cycle 25 peaks, experts warn of increased space weather events, posing risks to technology and daily life.

title: Trump to seek emergency appeal against court order ruling tariffs ‘illegal’

description: Residents of a few villages have already shifted to safer locations identified by the authorities after floodwaters entered their homes.

description: To address the surge, MCD Standing Committee Chairperson Satya Sharma said that 20 to 30 additional beds have been arranged in hospitals.

title: Yamuna breaches evacuation mark, residents moved to makeshift camps
description: Authorities evacuate residents from the low-lying areas after the water level crossed the danger mark earlier in the day; CM assures people at a relief camp that the situation is under control; all departments on high alert and the govt. is ready to tackle any possible flooding, says Parvesh

title: Indore shocker: Newborn bit by rats in NICU dies; staff suspended, probe ordered
description: A newborn, bitten by rats in MY Hospital's NICU, has died, sparking outrage and investigations. Hospital officials claim the death was due to the infant's fragile health, not the rat bites. Disciplinary actions have been taken, including suspensions and show-cause notices to staff. An inquiry committee has been formed, and the pest control agency fined.

description: Deputy Commissioner Vikram Singh visited the sensitive villages to take stock of the situation and made an appeal to the villagers to shift to the safe homes built by the administration in time

description: THe High Court of Karnataka has stayed the National Medical Commission’s decision of not permitting students to the first-year MBBS course for 2025-26 in the Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College, Belagavi, based on bribery allegations

title: BJP delegation asks BC commission to drop Christian sub-castes listed for survey
description: The BJP urged the Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes, headed by Madhusudan R. Naik, to drop Christian ‘sub castes’ listed in the draft list of castes ahead of the socio-educational survey of the State population

title: ‘Spy links’: Punjab YouTuber held with dam, airbase photos; chargesheet cites Pak contact
description: Punjab Police's SSOC has filed a chargesheet against YouTuber Jasbir Singh, accusing him of espionage for Pakistan. The investigation revealed photographs of sensitive locations like Bhakra Dam and an Air Force airstrip on his phone.

description: Police said that the woman fell into the pit, which was covered with a wooden material, in the early hours of Tuesday. They were alerted after a boy, who went past the area in the morning, saw her lying in the pit.

title: Nagaland Assembly defers discussion on satanic worship
description: The Nagaland Joint Christian Forum had criticised the decision to take up the issue in the House

Proposed 40% GST will cripple business, says top casino operator
description: Delta Corp has put its Rs 2,000-2,500 crore integrated resort-cum-casino township project in Goa on hold due to uncertainty surrounding potential GST slab changes. The company fears that a proposed 40% GST rate on casinos would render the sector unviable, impacting jobs, tourism, and revenue collection. Delta Corp is also concerned about retrospective GST demands.

description: Due to heavy rainfall and flood-like situations across the NCR, district authorities in Noida and Ghaziabad have ordered all schools, from nursery to Class 12, to remain closed on Wednesday, September 3, 2025. The decision prioritizes student safety amidst the India Meteorological Department's forecast of very heavy showers in western Uttar Pradesh, leading to waterlogging in low-lying areas.

Almond allergy: As FDA recalls ice cream for nut allergy risk, what symptoms to watch for
description: A recent ice cream recall in New York, involving The Ice Cream Factory's Vanilla G.Nutt flavor, has raised concerns about undeclared almonds. Sold in select stores, the ice cream poses a risk to those with almond allergies, potentially causing severe reactions. Almond allergies, triggered by proteins like Pru du 6, can manifest in various symptoms, including anaphylaxis.

Pakistan: 11 killed, 40 injured after suicide bombing at political rally; probe on
description: A suicide bombing at a Balochistan National Party rally in Quetta, Pakistan, resulted in at least 11 fatalities and 18 injuries. The explosion took place in the stadium parking area where hundreds of BNP supporters had congregated. Emergency services responded swiftly, and an investigation has been initiated, though no group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

George Raveling: Who was the legendary coach? a look back on his career
description: George Raveling, the iconic college basketball coach and former Nike executive, has passed away at 88 after battling cancer. Inducted into the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame in 2015, Raveling broke barriers as the first Black head coach in the Pacific-8 Conference. His family shared the news, highlighting his lasting impact on countless lives through his wisdom and kindness.

description: The UK Home Office will send texts to Indian students. The texts will warn against making false asylum claims to stay in the UK. Overstaying visas will lead to removal. This action comes as the UK aims to reduce asylum claims. The government wants to close asylum hotels. Many asylum claims are from those already in the UK on visas.

Discount grows: Russian crude gets even cheaper for India; Delhi continues to resist US pressure
description: India is facing increased pressure from the US over its growing Russian oil imports, leading to a 50% tariff imposed by the Trump administration. Despite widening discounts on Russian Urals crude, making it cheaper than US alternatives, the US accuses India of funding Russia's war in Ukraine through these purchases.

title: ‘Minnesota royalty’: Justin Jefferson, Suni Lee’s State Fair photo stuns fans
description: The Minnesota State Fair became a celebrity hotspot when Vikings' Justin Jefferson and Olympic gymnast Sunisa Lee were spotted together, igniting social media. Lee shared a photo on Instagram, quickly turning the internet into a commentary section, with fans dubbing them "Minnesota royalty." This surprise crossover highlighted the pride and excitement surrounding these two homegrown stars.

title: ‘I chose a better future’: Youngest female billionaire on why she dropped out of college
description: Lucy Guo, the youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her success to her frugal upbringing and early entrepreneurial spirit. Despite disappointing her immigrant parents by dropping out of Carnegie Mellon, she pursued the Thiel Fellowship and founded successful ventures like Scale AI and Passes.

title: Court blocks Cognizant from using its logo in India - here's why
description: The Bombay High Court has reinstated a ban on Cognizant's logo in India, pending the resolution of a trademark infringement lawsuit filed by Atyati Technologies. This decision overturns a previous order and revives an earlier injunction against the IT company. Cognizant faces other legal battles, including disputes with Wipro and Infosys, involving employee poaching and alleged intellectual property violations.

title: Micah Parsons FaceTimes heartbroken Cowboys fan, vows to make him proud
description: After a shocking trade sent Micah Parsons to the Green Bay Packers, a young Cowboys fan's emotional reaction went viral. Parsons responded with empathy, FaceTiming the child, offering encouragement, and promising a Packers jersey. Green Bay then signed Parsons to a record-breaking contract, setting the stage for his return to Dallas as a Packer.

title: Paulina Gretzky stuns in gothic look on Italy trip with Dustin Johnson
description: Paulina Gretzky, daughter of Wayne Gretzky and wife of Dustin Johnson, is making waves with her daring all-black ensemble during her Italian getaway. Showcasing her evolving style on the LTK app, Gretzky's look features a mix of edgy and luxury pieces, including a Helsa Poplin Bra and Bottega Veneta mules.

title: Brittany Mahomes: Some women are disrespectful pursuing Patrick
description: Brittany Mahomes, wife of NFL star Patrick Mahomes, has addressed her past insecurities regarding attention from other women towards her husband. She admitted that disrespectful behavior from some women used to bother her. However, Brittany has grown to a point where she is unbothered and focused on her family with Patrick, whom she met in high school.

title: Apple & Samsung to Xiaomi: Stop using our phones; 'Cease and Desist' notice sent
description: Apple and Samsung have reportedly initiated legal action against Xiaomi in India over advertisements that allegedly disparage their products. These ads, comparing Xiaomi's offerings to Apple's iPhones and Samsung's TVs, have sparked concerns about brand value erosion in the competitive Indian market. The legal notices highlight the intense battle for market share in the world's second-largest smartphone arena.

title: 'I feel bad': Patrick Mahomes' wife Brittany opens up about emotional toll of motherhood
description: Brittany Mahomes, wife of Patrick Mahomes and mother of three, recently shared her experiences with the challenges of motherhood. She highlighted the difficulty of balancing personal time with childcare responsibilities and confessed to struggling with mom guilt when accepting help or leaving her children. Despite these struggles, she remains a dedicated supporter of her husband's NFL career.
